meanings.definition: The quality of being open and honest in expression; frankness.
meanings.sent1: Her candors in admitting her mistake impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your candors in telling me the truth.
meanings.sent3: His candors about his fear of spiders made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: The candors of the child were like a refreshing breeze in the room.
meanings.sent5: The candors of the old man were as clear as a cloudless sky.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sincere and straightforward.
meanings.sent1: The candors of her apology touched my heart.
meanings.sent2: His candors in dealing with difficult situations are admirable.
meanings.sent3: The candors of the comedian made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: In a world of deceit, her candors shone like a beacon of light.
meanings.sent5: The candors of the leader inspired trust among the team.

meanings.definition: The act of being truthful and straightforward in speech or action.
meanings.sent1: His candors during the interview won him the job.
meanings.sent2: We value candors in our communication with each other.
meanings.sent3: The candors of the detective helped solve the case quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her candors were like a mirror reflecting pure intentions.
meanings.sent5: The candors of the artist were evident in every stroke of the brush.
